contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Humbert II of Savoy|Humbert II of Savoy, King of Italy|Umberto II of Italy}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox nobility | name = Umberto II, Count of Savoy | image = | caption = | noble family = [[House of Savoy]] | father = [[Amadeus II of Savoy]] | mother = [[Joan of Geneva]] | spouse = [[Gisela of Burgundy, Countess of Savoy|Gisela of Burgundy]] | birth_date = 1065 | birth_place = [[Carignano]] | death_date = {{death date|1103|10|14|df=y}} | death_place = }} '''Umberto II''', surnamed '''the Fat''' (1065, [[Carignano]], [[Piedmont]] – 14 October 1103), was Count of [[Savoy]] from 1080 until his death in 1103. He was the son of [[Amadeus II of Savoy]]. He was married to [[Gisela of Burgundy, Countess of Savoy|Gisela of Burgundy]], daughter of [[William I, Count of Burgundy]], and had 7 children: *[[Amadeus III of Savoy]] *William, [[Bishopric of Liège|Bishop of Liège]] *[[Adélaide de Maurienne|Adelaide]], (d. 1154), married to [[Louis VI of France]] *Agnes, (d. 1127), married to Archimbald VI, lord of [[House of Bourbon|Bourbon]] *Umberto *Reginald *Guy, abbey of [[Namur (city)|Namur]] {{s-start}} {{s-hou|[[House of Savoy]]||1065|14 October|1103|name=Umberto II the Fat}} {{s-reg}} {{s-bef|before=[[Amadeus II of Savoy|Amadeus II]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[County of Savoy|Count of Savoy]]| years = c. 1080–1103}} {{s-aft|after=[[Amadeus III of Savoy|Amadeus III]]}} {{s-end}} {{Counts of Savoy}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2012}} {{Persondata | NAME = Umberto II, Count of Savoy | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Umberto II the Fat | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Count of Savoy (c.1080-1103) | DATE OF BIRTH = 1065 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Carignano]] | DATE OF DEATH = 1103-10-14 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Umberto 02, Count of Savoy}} [[Category:1065 births]] [[Category:1103 deaths]] [[Category:People from Carignano]] [[Category:House of Savoy]] {{Europe-royal-stub}}
